thinking.disposable_income: Gage Park is a working-class community with median income of $50,112 and per capita income of $19,524. About 50% of households earn less than $50,000 annually, indicating limited disposable income for many residents
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With high percentage of lower-income households and large average household size (3.4), discretionary spending is likely constrained. Higher sales taxes or transportation costs would significantly impact household budgets
thinking.accessibility: 20.5% of households have no vehicle, and 17.9% use transit for commuting. While 59.6% drive alone, the high proportion of transit-dependent residents suggests need for affordable and efficient public transit
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized proposals with lower sales tax (0.5%) to minimize impact on limited household budgets. 2. Favored lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to help transit-dependent residents. 3. Supported moderate driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit service without overly burdening drivers. 4. Balanced travel time improvements with cost considerations. 5. Selected proposals that reduce both transit and driving times while keeping costs manageable for mixed-mode community
